alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 7:31AM EST until December 23 at 2:30AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Elliston, and from Edwardsport to Hazleton. .Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches from Friday night into Saturday caused minor flooding to develop along portions of the White River and the East Fork White River in southern parts of central Indiana. The crest on the White River is nearing Edwardsport with points downstream steady to slowly rising. The crest on the East Fork White River is near Seymour with flooding expected to end by late Tuesday. Flooding along the White River is expected to last into Thursday for points downstream of Newberry. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding affects low agricultural lands, low oil fields and closes Bottoms Rd...Brothers Rd and East Govenors Road in Knox County. In agricultural season...farmers are concerned at this stage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Monday /5:30 AM CST Monday/ the stage was 16.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM EST Monday /5:30 AM CST Monday/ was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 16.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall to 16.6 feet and begin rising again tomorrow evening. It will rise to 16.7 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued later this morning.
